title: The Best There Is
text: I am a repeat customer of this particular trip, because it is such an amazing day. The excellent pilot and guides are the best there is. I have had such great times on this trip. A float plane ride, a boat to the fishing spot where the sockeye are teeming, and bears are fishing with you. If you are looking to have everything you could want to do in Alaska in one day, want to treat a visitor, or are looking to support Alaskan businesses and have a blast, go High Adventure Air.
place: Wolverine Creek Fly Out Sockeye Salmon Fishing From Soldotna

title: Best Indian Food Anywhere
text: Saffron is such a treat when in Juneau. The food is far superior to either Indian place in Anchorage making it THE BEST Indian food in Alaska. Never miss an opportunity to dine there!

title: Awesome! Do not miss this amazing site.
text: It is worth walking up and seeing all of the structures in this sacred place. The view from there is worthwhile also and gives you a better perspective of Athens.

title: Dish Dependent Quality
text:
Great location and view! Fantastic for happy hour. I found the entrees to be highly inconsistent in quality.
Moon fish was overcooked and terrible. Pesto squash dish was fantastic!!!! Good drinks (albeit $16 cocktails) and good service. Live music adds much.

title: Nice Bar
text: I enjoyed the bar but was looking for dinner. Probably not the best choice for a dinner out but a great happy hour stop on the way!

title: Fantastic Choice for Brunch
text: Kelly and Zuke's was the perfect choice for fueling up on excellent coffee and brunch before a day of walking around Portland. Don't miss it.

title: Great Choice!
text: If you appreciate historical sites and classic bars with friendly service, this is a great choice. The seafood is excellent as well.

title: Zues Cafe is Top Notch
text: I was very glad I stopped in for brunch. Excellent food and choices with great art deco and atmosphere right in the Pearl. The staff is excellent as well. I think I will stay at the Crystal next time!

title: Unique Hotel with Just the Basics
text: The hotel is small and has everything you need if you don't need much! For a good night's sleep and is walking-distance from better neighborhoods, it was fine. Very friends staff and helpful concierge.

title: A Once in a Lifetime experience
text: We stayed in an Air BNB inside the fortress which was just amazing. The castle, cobblestone town, shops, and restaurants were unique and fun. A nice beach where we spent the day swimming and enjoying the sun and view is a short walk away as well.

title: Great appetizers and drinks with a rooftop bar in Times Square
text: Go l the way to the top and have a cocktail looking out over Times Square. The appetizers were great and the service was awesome.

title: Adorable High Quality Italian Food and Service in Times Square
text: I enjoyed the chicken parm. Nothing fancy, just famous. Was hoping for more of a wine list, but an overall great experience.

title: Great Location for Theatre Goers
text: I've stayed here twice and enjoyed the location, the service and accommodations very much. Steps from amazing food, Broadway, many theatres, Half Price ticket stand, and subway stations. Surprisingly quiet and comfortable right in the middle of Times Square.
place: Hilton Garden Inn New York/Times Square Central

title: Perfect Location and an Excellent Stay
text: We were in town for a conference and stayed here. The service was amazing and the location was perfect. It was surprisingly quiet and very comfortable. I would stay here again and again. Good value for the price and competitive for downtown. Access to BART and cable cars are steps away and there is a great place for coffee and breakfast next door.

title: Worth the Trip
text: I had always wanted to visit there and was glad I did. The audio tour is worth it and so interesting to see and hear about the history and events there. Get tickets in advance though, way in advance.

title: Very Nice Rooms and Excellent Service
text: I love this hotel and convention center, but like many, it is pricey and somewhat remote from the heart of the city. Yu must be willing to pay to get around to other areas once you have explored the harbor. Lovely!

title: Really good food and good value. Service was terrible.
text: Brisket, pulled pork, hot chicken were all great! The service was slow and not because they were busy (with us). Wait staff and bar tender had much better things to do than wait on people.

title: The food was reason good, the service was awful.
text: I went for happy hour and oysters. All were great once someone noticed I was there and could stop complaining to co-workers about her job. I would have ordered more and stayed longer but it didn't seem worth the time I would have to invest.
place: The Walrus Oyster and Ale House

title: Always a MUST in D.C.
text: I love this place. The service is excellent even though it is always packed and popular for every meal at any hour. They are professional and efficient, every time I have been there and I have never had bad service, a bad meal or drink. Our everything person behond the bar, Michele, was amazing.

title: Outstanding and a MUST if in Times Square
text: We went there twice in three days because we liked it so much. A small but highly efficient place for breakfast or lunch and a wonderful menu for a true New Yok experience of great food. Get the pastrami!

title: A Perfect Choice for our Weekend in Times Square
text: This hotel was perfectly located and had great rooms with great views as well as top notch service. I would stay here again and again. It's in a great spot if you are in town for shoes or shopiing or just to experience Times Square.

title: Always Busy and for Good Reason
text: The food here is always top notch no matter what you order. The service is professional and attentive like a well-oiled machine. Not every place operates like this in high season on the beach! It's a treat and I found myself there at least 6 times in 9 days.

title: Always a Fun Spot
text: Get there early though, the place is small and fills up immediately. Fun people in a fun spot! Cash only but service is awesome.

title: Expansive Menu and Good Food
text: The service is hit or miss depending on when you are there and whether you are there alone or with a group. The atmosphere is a mix of beachside bar and white tablecloth which I liked a lot. It was easy and casual but great meals. I went back again and again while I was in PV.

title: Always a Good Choice
text: I have been to Pipi's many times for a reason. The food and service are top notch. When you want to go be pampered, go to Pipi's! Skip the resorts.

title: Updated in Every Way
text: I travel to Juneau frequently and have avoided what used to be the Goldbelt for a few years in favor of other places. The remodel has made this place worth staying in! The rooms are clean and quiet, with everything you need, The service is friendly and professional. I will be back!'

title: Food and Drinls Okay, Service SO-SO
text: It wasn't that bust but service took a very long time to even engage. Lots of other interests going on with the employees, beyond the customers. But relaxed and casual and I wasn't in a big hurry. DOn't go there in a hurry! Spend some time, watch sports and hang out. Eventually they will find you.

title: Very Nice Rooms, Poorly Run
text:
I have stayed a few times and the rooms are awesome. They are clean and comfortable with everything you need. Mostly. I checked in, after a day of traveling and entered a room that had not yet been cleaned. Unmade bed, trash, towels, obviously not cleaned since the last guest. I was given a different, clean room. Unfortunately, the coffee cartridges provided were not for the coffee maker in the room, but I improvised. I had received a phone call a few days before letting me know the pool was not operational, so I left my suit. The pool was working fine when I checked in. :(
The next day, after working all day, I came to the room and the key didn't work. Housekeeping had been there but didn't finish ?!? Went down and had to call a number to find a person, got the key remagnetized. New key did not work. A few more trips and calls and I finally was able to get in my wonderful room and take the coffee pods apart for the morning. :)

title: Fresh, All the Way Around
text: I have been there three times and have the same opinion. It is a cool tiny place with seating for maybe 20, but it served the freshest Alaskan oysters on the half shell, as well as a number of cooked oysters. French champagne by the glass. Fabulous. Pricey, and unless the owner is there, the service is terrible.

title: Always the BEST
text: The hardest part is getting a reservation, which should tell you something! Best steaks and cocktails in town.

title: Not Enough Praise for This Place
text: I have visited for lunch and for dinner and the food is incredible. What a treasure in Seward. Order seafood. Order anything. The care and attention given to the flavors and the dishes offered rival any fancy over-priced place in Seattle or Portland. Better!

title: Great Location and Service
text: Nice, clean room and service that is trying very hard to please. The best part is being across the street from The Cookery. They are awesome. Also in walking distance are several places anyone visiting Seward should see. Try to get a quiet room.

title: Comfortable Neighborhood Hangout
text: We visited several times during our stay in Uptown. Food is good and service is great. Local music, local peeps watching sports on TV and just hanging out. It was perfect.

title: Not Particularly South African, But Very Good Food
text: The atmosphere was nice but too loud for conversation. The food was excellent, although not South African in any way other than one (not very spicy) sauce. I was disappointed the cuisine was not authentic but I did enjoy what we had. Wine list was so-so and overpriced. Service was excellent.

title: Good Food and Great Value
text: Our family ate there and had great meals without spending a ton of money. Service was good and we will be back.

title: Fantastic Place to Stay in Ninilchik
text: If you need to stay in the area or even of you don't......it is worthwhile to spend some time here. Mike is a fabulous host and an impressive cook! He really goes the extra mile to make sure his guests are comfortable and informed about Alaska. The place is gorgeous and the views will have you on the deck or watching for wildlife out the window your entire stay.

title: Unmatched Knowledge, Experience, and Professionalism = FUN
text: Whether you need gear, want to take certification classes or go on an adventure with fantastic guides, this is the place. I have done all of the above and wouldn't go anywhere else. Because of Last Frontier I have confident skills, quality gear, and priceless memories from amazing diving trips. I will be doing way more with them, no question!

title: Great Location and Drinks
text: I enjoyed this place, but had to re-order dishes. They were awesome about re-dos and the food did come out perfect afterward! Very good wines and cocktails and the service was fantastic.

title: Beautiful Spot for Valentine's Day Getaway
text: We enjoyed this resort for its location and our excellent room with a great oceanside view. We were disappointed in the food and would recommend getting out of the resort for dinner and exploring some much better cuisine. we visited from Alaska so we were really looking to warm up and spend time in the water, but that wasn't happening. We knew the ocean would be too cold to dive, snorkel or swim in, but we counted on the pools. The pools were freezing cold and way too uncomfortable for swimming. I forced myself in there a few times to cool down but it was way too cold even for Alaskans. Most visitors were in the hot tub just to get wet. :(

title: The Best Experience and Meal We Had in Mazatlan
text: Los Arcos was recommended by a local and did not disappoint. The atmosphere, service and food were outstanding. Great cocktails and tequila choices too! The chef specials really were special and amazing. We were so glad we spent our last night in Mazatlan at the best restaurant we had found in a week.

title: Great Idea, Disappointing Food
text: I wasn't sure what to expect, but the food was not great. The choices mostly all seem to contain crab (or imitation crab) which I don't care for. I love tuna rolls but none came without crab and or cream cheese. Yuck. Seemed like a sushi place for people who don't actually eat sushi. I enjoyed the edamame, but that was about it. :(

title: Tadich Never Disappoints
text: If you have never been to the Tadich Grill and you are in San Francisco, it is a must-do. Get in early for a cocktial at the bar and get your name on the list for a table and a fabulous dinner. I have only ordered seafooddishes so far, because they ar fabulous. The wine list is quite nice and their cocktails are top-notch. The service is fantastic and it is an overall treat to be in an original San Francisco establishment dating back so many years and fond memories.

title: Mostly Pleasant Stay
text: I stayed here with co-workers on a business trip and had a pleasnat stay. The key cards did not always work, but the staff are very friendly and accommodating. Rooms are clean and comfortable with everything there that you need The only real issue was noise from other guests making sleep difficult.

title: Great Place for Local and Visitors!
text: I visited twice in my 4 days there. The service is excellent and the drinks and food are top notch. Friendly atmosphere and also accommodating to groups, families, couples, anyone. Happy hour specials are great. Have the filet and prawns. OMG!

title: Great Spot and Decent Food if You Have Time to Wait
text: This was our first dining experience in Amsterdam as it was near our rented apartment. It is a great spot in a great location along the canal and across from the Ann Frank House. We were famished. The food was acceptable but it took forever to order anything at all. The time between drink order and food was about an hour. Then another 45 to receive it. It wasn't particularly busy at all but super slow. A fine place to hang out if you have the time.

title: Great after work pub in a historical spot!
text: We toured the actual Cutty Sark for a few hours and then met frineds at the Cutty Sark pub for tapas and beers. Everything was excellent and friendly. It felt like we were locals hanging out at our neighborhood pub but with the historical nautical atmosphere we loved. Wish we had more time to hang out.

title: A fun place near the Towers
text: The name alone drew us in but the food and service were top notch. Prepare for London Pub fare of meat pie and fish and chips, pints of beer and a jovial, fun staff of people having fun waiting on you.

title: Wonderful Museum
text: It is a great place to learn more about the life and art of Vincent Van Gough and see his work. The staff are Danish and rigid so be sure to know and follow the rules so you don't get yelled at. :(

title: Great Cocktails and Happy Hour
text: We met friends here and had a great time. Even though they were extremely busy, the place was clean, efficient and friendly with quality cocktails that were not over priced. Bravo!

title: Excellent Choice in Fairbanks for Sushi
text: Beautiful, fresh and delicious. I was craving sushi and was very glad I stopped in for dinner. The service was excellent and the sushi/sashimi dinner was absolutely perfect. I will be back!

title: The Best Indian Cuisine To Date
text: This place was recommended by locals and did NOT disappoint. If there is a wait, it is worth it. The food and service are excellent. Every dish sampled was superb. I wish we had had the time to visit again before leaving London.

title: A Must Do in Amsterdam but Don't Expect Much
text: It was important to me to experience this historical site but it was rather disappointing in what is actually left preserved in it. Mostly it is photos of what used to be there and limited access to the actual spots you have read about and want to see. The energy of the place is now so touristy much of the impact is reduced or at least it was for me especially after waiting 2 hours in line. BUY TICKETS ONLINE and skip that mess.

title: I love this place for lunch!
text: Great food and not really downtown prices. Stop in for lunch and you won't be disappointed. It's small so a large group won't work but if it's just you or you and a friend, do it.

title: The Best Experience and Most Amazing Food and Wine
text: A reservation/booking is a must. We lucked out and had lunch in the fine dining restaurant which was an experience I enjoyed tremendously and will not forget. The wine is exceptional and the history if the vineyard is fascinating. You will be added to the list of many famous visitors there. Walk the grounds and see everything, taste everything and take some with you. It was truly a great experience.

title: Very Nice Atmosphere
text: We enjoyed an afternoon here but found the service to be poor-fair and the wines to be so-so. It was a beautiful spot for a picnic but not great if you were looking to really learn about the wines or the vineyard.

title: Small and cozy rooms in the heart of Hipster London
text: The location is great if you are wanting to be away from touristy London yet is an easy walk to the tube to go anywhere else. It is definitely outside the main area of London but great for trendy restaurants and pubs.

title: A great place for our first pub stop in London!
text: Cozy and trendy yet traditional pub atmosphere. Friendly service and welcoming to visitors. This was a great place to have our first pub experience off the plane in London!

title: Expert Service and good food
text: I stopped in for a lite dinner and of course, beer. The place was packed with people and I found the only seat left. Entire parties of people chose to eat standing up. Even with all of that going on the service was superb. I was totally amazed at how quick and attentive the waitstaff were to so many people at once!

title: Excellent Choice for Sushi and Sashimi in Fairbanks
text: The owner is the chef and he takes great pride in all of it. The sashimi and sushi dinner for one was beautiful and delicious. The service is excellent. It could not have been better.

title: Great Value and Location
text: I wouldn't have thought of Bally's but I am so glad I did. The rooms were better than Caesars and for MUCH less. I did not care for the content and aggressive sales people in shops and walkways, but the stay was certainly worth it!

title: Top of the World has Slipped to Average
text: I have been to this restaurant to celebrate a few very special occasions over the last 15 years. All visits were excellent until last week. The service was slow to average and the food was not as good as I remembered. The novelty is really what they are selling. I should have chosen better for my 50th birthday dinner as it was a bit of a let down instead of the treat that was intended to spoil me. They don;t help you celebrate in any sort of way at all.

title: Excellent food and value depending on your order
text: This is a great place to get a great meal without paying ridiculous hotel/casino/resort prices. If you want a steak that doesn't cost $60 or more, try the prime rib special. It is excellent. Skip the mahimahi tacos, they were soggy and stuffed with nasty coleslaw.

title: Best Massage of my Life
text: The spa is excellent and the staff are very attentive without being in your face. The massage I got for a gift was the best ever, and I have had many. Ask for Irvena.

title: Excellent for Romantic Dinner
text: Whether on a date or watching the people go by, this is a great spot with excellent food. The menu is impressive as is the wine list. Everything was terrific. The service was also excellent.

title: Nice comfy hangout with great food.
text: This became a home base of sorts while staying at Caesars Palace. The $11 beers and $18 cocktails were a bit much but the food was priced reasonable and everything we had was perfect. Try the blue cheese wedge salad...it's huge and a much better deal than your beer. Also try the corned beef sandwich if you like corned beef and cabbage.

title: What a perfect day.
text: This was a very classy experience from start to finish and I could not be happier to have done it. A beautiful stretch picks you up and takes you home from the most amazing helicopter tour of the Grand Canyon and the Strip. Just awesome.

title: Was Expecting More
text: I love aquariums and was very excited by all the build up of this shark exhibit. It was great to see, but was not all that is described. The website talks about over 1000 predators and much more to see than is actually there. The fish poop smell is somewhat distracting and actually made me want to get out of there sooner than I might have. Where are all the rest of the sharks? I am sticking to scuba.

title: Excellent Spot to Hang Out and eat Breakfast
text: I keep coming back to Paris because I love this crepe shop. The prices are reasonable for where they are and the food is great. The dishes are authentic and fabulous.

title: The Best Sushi in Anchorage
text: There are a lot of sushi places in Anchorage but Peter's is always just a little bit better as is the service.

title: Great Food and Excellent Service
text:
The food and beverage selections are great and the meals are quite good. Service is excellent every visit, unlike other places where it is hit or miss depending on the day.
I have been there for brunch and for dinner and both were excellent.

title: Great place to meet up with friends
text: The food is good and the service is quick and attentive. Great local beer selection! Try the pretzels, they are excellent!

title: Always a good experience with excellent food
text: This is the go-to downtown for breakfast and a great place for a quick quality lunch you won't easily find elsewhere. Always a good experience.

title: This is an experience you can't afford to miss.
text: I can't imagine why anyone would come to Alaska and not visit the Alaska Native Heritage Center! You will not be disappointed, as it is a fantastic place with so much to see and learn. The people are extraordinary and you won't really want to leave. I also can't imaging living in Alaska and not visiting here. Don't miss out!

title: Great Choice for a Terrific Dinner with Friends
text:
The venue is nice and cozy and although it's a little loud for conversing, the food and service are excellent. Great drink menu, wine menu is impressive and food was terrific.
The overall experince will have us returning for special occasions or date night!

title: Great food if you order wisely
text: I would love to come back and try again. I did not order well having gone with the fish and not the pasta. It was way over salted as were the roasted potatoes. Everything on my entrÃ©e was overwhelmed by salt. The caesar salad with anchovies was excellent! My spouse had the ravioli which was excellent and I had a bite of gnocchi that I liked but not as well. Get the signature pasta dish and I am sure you will be pleased. Service was excellent.

title: Best Ribs ever
text: This place has a long history of making the best ribs you can find. Their coleslaw is also the best I have had, and I am not a fan of coleslaw. Need a pie? The homemade pies are exceptional. Dine in or take it home and feast.

title: Best food and value
text: Yum! I can never get past the appetizers menu to try entrees. Spicy tuna rolls, lettuce wraps, fresh rolls....I'm finished and very happy.

title: The best diner on the planet
text: The Sugar Spoon is not just an ld fashioned diner, it's a gathering place. You won't find nicer people or better food anywhere.

title: A great meal with excellent service and good prices. Wow!
text: We were catching a show at the Fillmore and looking for a nearby place to have dinner. We decided to try this place though we knew nothing of it and had never seen the menu. It turned out to be exactly what we wanted. The meals were great and not overpriced. We brought our own wine and had some of theirs making it all very nice and affordable for four. The service was just perfect. Thank you! We will be back!

title: Right on time and professionally operated
text: It's nice to count on a service and enjoy the ride. Clean, professional and on time. Excellent. I love this place.
